title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Thursday 28 December 2017 - BBC News
summary: man thrown from car in m1 crash .
suspected arson at m & s store .
young ms patient placed in elderly home .

documents.title: ipswich town 1-2 derby county
text: ipswich town 1-2 derby county

documents.title: nottingham forest 0-1 sunderland
text: nottingham forest 0-1 sunderland

documents.title: two charged over 'christmas terror plot '
text: two charged over 'christmas terror plot '

documents.title: shopkeeper uses karate on armed robber
text: shopkeeper uses karate on armed robber

documents.title: our live coverage has ended
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: weather : yellow warning for ice
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for ice across the east midlands with temperatures expected to drop below zero tonight .
it 's expected to remain dry through the evening with clear skies and light winds .
a very cold night is then expected , with a widespread frost , and a risk of ice as rain spreads in later in the night
tomorrow will be a cold , bright start for northeastern areas .
however cloudier in the west with rain spreading northeast , and snow likely across the peak district .
turning less cold , although winds strengthening .

documents.title: collin street footbridges to be removed
text: two footbridges over collin street are to be pulled down next week as part of the redevelopment of nottingham 's broadmarsh centre .
the work will see the road closed overnight from 20:00 to 08:00 on friday 5 and saturday 6 january .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: boxing day tragedy : man found dead in chesterfield was homeless
text: a man who was found dead in chesterfield on boxing day was homeless , the derbyshire times has learned .
paramedics found the body of david fuller , 41 , of no fixed abode , inside a derelict building on chatsworth road on tuesday night .
author: Derbyshire Times

documents.title: watch : 'best year ' for blind footballer
text: a man from mansfield , who lost his sight at the age of 19 , has said 2017 has been his best year yet .
nathan edge was called up to play for england just 18 months after he started playing blind football .
back in august he helped the national team bring home a bronze medal from the blind football european championships in berlin .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: ex-rams boss mcclaren linked with sheffield wednesday
text: two-time former derby county boss steve mcclaren has left his role as coaching consultant at israeli club maccabi tel aviv .
maccabi chief executive ben mansford said the 56-year-old was leaving the club to `` pursue other options '' .
mcclaren , who was sacked by the rams in march , has been linked with the vacant managers ' position at sheffield wednesday .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: leicester city : simpson 'out for up to five weeks '
text: claude puel has confirmed that danny simpson is expected to be out for around four or five weeks .
the right back pulled up with a suspected hamstring injury against manchester united last saturday and missed the boxing day trip to watford .
who puel will to replace simpson is up for discussion - alexandar dragovic played the full 90 minutes at vicarage road but the foxes also welcome back daniel amartey from suspension .
author: Owynn Atkin
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: meet the modern-day good samaritans
text: these are the volunteers at the end of the phone when someone in distress calls the samaritans .
if you are affected by these issues please contact the samaritans on the free helpline 116 123 , or visit the website .
author: Cath Mackie
BBC News

documents.title: your comments : young ms sufferer in home for elderly
text: a story about a young woman with ms , who had to live in a care home with elderly people , has got a lot of you talking on facebook .
before 38-year-old joanne head , right , died in 2015 , she had to have 24-hour care due .
her sister vicky cook , left , said most residents in the home were over 65 and some had dementia .
pat lilley said : `` this is truly awful .
i blame this sort of thing on the government .
cutting back on necessary provision for care .
england is so short of so much yet it lets money go out to other countries before looking after their own . ''
michael broughton said : `` if you are under 21 or over 65 there seems to be care accommodation available but between those ages there are little or no provision .
my lovely sister had ms in her 40 's and we seriously struggled to find anywhere in the uk that could look after her that was n't geriatric . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: decision made over controversial plans to build 100 homes
text: controversial plans to build more than 100 homes on a council-owned plot of green space in leicester have been approved .

more than 700 residents objected to the proposal to develop parts of the eight acre franklyn fields site off lutterworth road in aylestone but the council 's planning committee voted through the scheme .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: notts to be gritted ahead of expected snow
text: the gritters are being sent out again .
with yellow and amber metoffice warnings for ice and snow currently in-place for parts of the county , our gritters will be out from 6pm this evening along all main and severe weather routes .
view our gritting routes
thank you from @ twitterid and i .
what a photo

the first few months looks grim .
beats countryfiles one
first time i 've ever seen a gritter come up are street aspley road sutton in ashfield in years !
would like to thank the person and hope it keeps coming up when the weather is bad were we live on a hill and get really icey and need it at this time of year thanks !

author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: shopkeeper 'uses karate skills ' to stop gunman
text: a shopkeeper in leicester has been telling me how he fought off a man with a gun who was trying to steal money from his store .
on christmas eve , sibu kuruvilla was working at premier leo 's supersaver in evington when a man came in with what appeared to be a gun .
mr kuruvilla gave the man £ 170 from the till but before he had chance to escape , the 43-year-old knocked the weapon from his hand and wrestled him to the ground .
he then held him on the floor for 15 minutes until the police arrived .
mr kuruvilla is a black belt in seibukan karate - he told me that might have been where he got his courage from to fight the robber .
despite his courageous reaction he said it was `` terrifying '' .
mr kuruvilla 's two daughters had been in the shop at the time - the girls aged seven and nine saw everything on the cctv camera from the office .
he said they have both been affected by what they saw and for the last few nights they 've woken up in the night to cuddle him .
leicestershire police said a 17-year-old male was arrested in connection with the incident and has been bailed pending police inquiries .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: hospitals make millions from car parking
text: university hospitals of leicester nhs trust took £ 4.2m last year from car parking fees .
just over two thirds of that came from patients and visitors , the rest was staff .
over the same period derby teaching hospitals nhs foundation trust took £ 3.9m and nottingham university hospitals nhs trust took £ 3.6m .
the 2016/17 figures have come from the press association who made a freedom of information request .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: google car travelling around east midlands
text: you might spot google 's street view car in our area over the coming weeks - if you have n't already seen it .
the web giant is midway through a four-month programme to update its street level shots of derbyshire - including the peak district - nottinghamshire and leicestershire .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: driver had unsafe toddler and no insurance
text: police stopped this driver in heath earlier and found not only was the car uninsured , there was also a two-year-old in the front with no child seat .
the car was confiscated and two fines were handed to the driver .

documents.title: your photos : winter in leicestershire
text: thanks to pete for a splendid photo of melton mowbray on this crisp winter 's afternoon .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: gritters deployed in derbyshire as more snow forecast
text: be careful if you have to drive anywhere tonight .
another freezing night ahead - with snow forecast for high ground , particularly the peak district , in the early hours .
we 're out gritting all secondary and primary routes this afternoon and evening .
snow plough teams at the ready .
see where we grit :
congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 17th for dec 28 . )
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: mcclure met future husband on movie set
text: vicky mcclure chose wollaton hall as the backdrop to her engagement announcement - although she gave no indication whether the proposal took place there .
she met film-maker and actor jonny owen when they appeared together in british film svengali in 2013 .
he said in 2014 : `` not only is she [ mcclure ] fantastic as michelle , but in the course of making the film we 've also grown close and ended up in a relationship together . ''
read more here .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : snow in rutland
text: there 's still plenty of snow on the ground in oakham but the sun 's out so that should help it thaw .
littleemmaduck sent us this photo of her back garden .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: driver thrown from car in m1 crash
text: more details have emerged about a two-car crash which closed the m1 southbound for several hours last night .
derbyshire police said a 31-year-old male driver was seriously injured when he was thrown from his honda civic after it hit a barrier and landed on its roof .
a 33-year-old woman and two children inside the car were treated for minor injuries .
police added that the driver of a ford fiesta also involved in the crash escaped serious injury .
the force has appealed for witnesses and dashcam footage of the collision , which happened near junction 29 for matlock and mansfield at about 19:40 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: study : house values soaring in ashbourne
text: homes in ashbourne are gaining value at a faster rate than almost anywhere else in britain , according to a new survey .
the figures , by zoopla , found property values in the derbyshire town had risen by 11.59 % between 1 january and 12 december , reaching an average of £ 354,815 .
it was second only to the seaside resort of clevedon in somerset , where property values had risen by 11.6 % .
nationally property values had risen by 3.5 % , zoopla said .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: car removed from nottingham tram tracks
text: net says the car has now been moved from tracks at nottingham station and trams are running normally again .
update 11:40 : the car has been removed from the tracks .
all services can now run through all parts of the system .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: no m & s staff hurt in leicester fire
text: we 've had a brief statement from m & s following the fire at its leicester store last night .
it said : `` all our colleagues are safe and our leicester store opened at 9am this morning . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: stolen puppies still missing
text: police are still looking for 17 puppies that were stolen from a house in selston more than six weeks ago .
the young dogs were only a week old when they were taken from an address in station road but police said they would now be at an age where they are ready to be sold .
three adult dogs who were taken in the same theft also remain missing .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: driver injured in m1 smash
text: a driver was taken to hospital following a two-car crash that closed the m1 for several hours last night .
the collision happened on the southbound carriageway near junction 29 - for mansfield and chesterfield - at about 19:45 .
derbyshire police said the driver of a honda was taken to the queen 's medical centre with serious but not life-threatening injuries .

documents.title: your photos : icy hathersage
text: it 's an icy day in derbyshire - david e took this pic in hathersage .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: derby-matlock line back to normal after breakdown disruption
text: some good news for train travellers .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: taxi driver 'assaulted by fare dodgers '
text: a taxi driver has been assaulted in loughborough after two people up from the amber rooms in the rushes , leicestershire police said .
the 45-year-old driver took the passengers to a petrol station - they then refused to pay the fare .
when the driver confronted the men he was assaulted and needed medical treatment .
leicestershire police are appealing for help to identify these men captured on cctv footage .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: damage caused by m & s 'arson '
text: this is the result of a fire at marks and spencer in leicester last night - the fire service believe it was started deliberately .
the shop is still open , despite some smoke damage to the ground and first floors .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: train breakdown disrupts derby/matlock services
text: something to be aware of if your plans for the day involve getting a train .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: funding appeal for teddy bears for grieving children
text: special `` comfort bears '' for nottinghamshire children who 've lost a loved one could be cut back because funding for the scheme 's been stopped .
the children 's bereavement centre in newark , which works with about 600 youngsters a year , has lost £ 25,000 in nhs funding .
they are now asking the public to donate £ 6 to pay for a bear .
we need to fundraise and get in about £ 300,000 a year .
we 're seeing more and more children coming forward and support .
we want to be able to be there when they need that support . ''
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: armed police swoop on car at supermarket
text: armed officers helped to arrest two men at asda in sinfin on sus of stealing a car in burton .
derbyshire police said the suspect vehicle was spotted by an unmarked car and followed to the supermarket before being boxed in by officers .
the force said the driver also tested positive for cocaine .

documents.title: watch : second day of disruption on uk roads
text: there are warnings of treacherous driving conditions this morning , as sub-zero temperatures cause disruption for a second day across large parts of the uk .
the met office has issued 15 weather warnings - jayne mccubbin is at catthopre in leicestershire .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: man arrested over security keypad thefts
text: a man has been arrested on sus of stealing electronic gate keypads from homes across nottinghamshire .

police detained the man following reports of more than 30 thefts between 21 and 24 december at properties in ravenshead , mansfield , sutton-in-ashfield , calverton , gonalston , halam , greasley and farnsfield .
the 32-year-old has been released while investigations continue .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: theatre shows you wo n't want to miss in 2018
text: from aidan turner and vanessa kirby in starring roles to two heavyweight productions of macbeth and a new musical about the assassination of katie hopkins - there 's much theatre to look forward to around the uk in 2018 .
one highlight is sherlock and the league of gentlemen 's mark gatiss in his element in alan bennett 's the madness of george iii at nottingham playhouse ( 2-17 november ) .
author: Ian Youngs
Entertainment and Arts Reporter, BBC News

documents.title: young ms patient placed in home for elderly people
text: a nottingham woman has called for better care for young disabled people after her sister had to share a care home with people more than twice her age .
before 38-year-old joanne head died in 2015 , she required 24-hour care due to advanced multiple sclerosis .
her sister , vicky cook , said most residents in the home were over 65 and some had dementia .
lincolnshire county council , which provided the care , said it works with families to find the right placements .
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: department store fire 'started deliberately '
text: marks and spencer in leicester city centre has been damaged in a suspected arson attack .
leicestershire fire and rescue service responded to a call at about 18:15 last night - it 's believed the fire was started in a porch entrance in fox lane .
smoke from the fire has damaged the exterior of the building and inside on the ground and first floor .
the cause has been recorded as `` believed deliberate ignition '' .
no one was injured .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: watch : today 's weather for the east midlands
text: here 's the outlook for the day ahead .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: cold weather causing 'treacherous ' road conditions
text: firstly , it 's worth knowing it 's blooming freezing out there today .
if you 're heading out in the car soon , here 's a warning from derbyshire police .
if your windscreen is frosted over like this make sure it 's clear before you drive .
heavy frost overnight and treacherous road conditions in patches .
allow extra time for your journey .

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning east midlands - i hope you 're enjoying this odd `` crimbo limbo '' period .
if you fancy using this time to keep up-to-date on local news , sport , weather and travel then gavin bevis and i will be here throughout the day to help you .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News
